election_record.label: New Jersey 1801 Speaker of the Assembly

overview.note: "The Legislature of New Jersey met this day, and proceeded to choosing a speaker of the house, when they chose Silas Dickerson, in the room of William Cox;--the vote stood as follows: twenty-two for Dickerson, the Republican, and 13 for Cox, the aristocratic candidate." American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). October 31, 1801.

"The session of the Legislature of this State, commenced on Tuesday last, agreeable to the constitution. A quorum was formed the first day, when Silas Dickerson, from Sussex, was chosen speaker, by a considerable majority." The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). November 3, 1801.

election_record.reference: American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). October 31, 1801.
The Centinel of Freedom (Newark, NJ). November 3, 1801.
